body:
I got the error message below.  How the **** am I supposed to figure out where the problem lies?  This error message needs to give more relevant information.
```
$ spack spec pism
Input spec
------------------------------
  pism

Normalized
------------------------------
  pism
      ^cmake
      ^fftw
      ^gsl
      ^mpi
      ^netcdf
          ^curl
              ^openssl
                  ^zlib
          ^hdf5
          ^m4
      ^proj
      ^python
          ^bzip2
          ^ncurses
          ^readline
          ^sqlite
      ^udunits2
          ^expat

Concretized
------------------------------
==> Error: Invalid spec: 'python@3.5.2%gcc@4.9.3~tk~ucs4 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64^bzip2@1.0.6%gcc@4.9.3 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64^ncurses@6.0%gcc@4.9.3 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64^openssl@system%gcc@4.9.3 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64^readline@6.3%gcc@4.9.3 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64^sqlite@3.8.5%gcc@4.9.3 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64^zlib@1.2.8%gcc@4.9.3 arch=linux-centos7-x86_64'. Package python requires version 2.6:2.7, but spec asked for 3.5.2
```
title: Improve Version Conflict Error Message
